summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, setting the trial start date for November 29, 2021, with jury selection the week of November 15, 2021. The order grants the government's motion to exclude time under the Speedy Trial Act and establishes deadlines for motions in limine and pretrial disclosures.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this order is issued, setting the trial schedule.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order, setting the trial schedule and deadlines for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Jury Selection Week
events.description: The court requests that jury selection for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial occur during this week.

events.title: Trial Commencement
events.description: The date set for opening statements to the jury in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, pending approval from the Clerk's Office.

events.title: Deadline for Joint Letter
events.description: The parties are ordered to submit a joint letter by this date regarding the overall pretrial disclosure schedule after meeting and conferring.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin with opening statements on November 29, 2021, and jury selection is set for the week of November 15, 2021.

Judge Alison J. Nathan granted the government's motion to exclude time under the Speedy Trial Act until November 29, 2021, citing the need for defense review of discovery, motion preparation, and trial preparation.
The order establishes that motions in limine must be fully briefed no later than four weeks before the November 29 trial date.
The parties are ordered to meet and confer by phone for at least 30 minutes and submit a joint letter by May 14, 2021, regarding the pretrial disclosure schedule.
